result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Steven Cobleigh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 01/22/2016 @ 1:30pm, Br-40

miscConds.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Provide DNA sample, pay the surcharge. Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Any amount reamining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.
- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to No Violent Contact.
- Maintain employment.

timeConds.notes: Huber for work ONLY. Defendant to report 09-17-15; failure to report will result in STRAIGHT TIME.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Steven Cobleigh

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joseph Steven Cobleigh in court PRO SE.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Joseph Steven Cobleigh in court with attorney Jennifer Flynn.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Victim Impact Statement received and filed.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
.
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction with Huber for work only.  Defendant to report 9/17/15; failure to report will result in straight time.  
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 1/22/16.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-DNA sample, pay the surcharge.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

-Maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-10-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph Steven Cobleigh in court with Attorney Jennifer Flynn.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for plea and sentencing.  Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advises defendant that all conditions of bail remain as previously set including the No Contact Order.
Clerk:  jms

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.E.A. dob 12-1-1992.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joseph Steven Cobleigh in court.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 40.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 07-24-2015 at 01:30pm
